lines.line: Right, let's go and see what Sarah has in mind.
I've come about the bounty.
Oh thank Saradomin! It's about time someone responded, something needs to be done!
Can you explain what happened?
Of course. I was making my monthly delivery to The Sheared Ram in Lumbridge, heading east near the Draynor Village crossroads.
Suddenly, out of the trees came a hulking monster! It chased me for a short distance, but luckily Rosie managed to spook it enough to give me a headstart.
Sounds like it must have given you quite the scare!
It certainly did. I even lost my cart full of farm produce!
What did this monster look like?
I didn't get a very good look at it I'm afraid. It was getting dark and as soon as I saw it charging at me, I ran.
I can still hear the sound, though. A horrible grunting... squealing...
Any tips on finding this thing?
Tips...? You're supposed to be the professional monster slayer!
Although, I suppose a good place to start would be checking the area I was attacked. See if you can find the remains of my cart.
Ok, yes that could work.
Whereabouts were you attacked again?
I remember being somewhere near the crossroads, north of Draynor Village.
Sorry that I'm not much help. It happened so fast, the whole thing is a bit of a blur.
That's okay. Crossroads north of Draynor... At least I have somewhere to start.
You mentioned that Rosie spooked the monster. Who's that?
Oh, that'll be our lady over there by the fire. She's such a good dog, always accompanies me on deliveries.
You can pet her if you like. She's very friendly.
I think that'll be all for now.
Excellent! Best of luck to you, I'll be waiting right here with your reward.
I'm still working on it... I've managed to find its lair though.
Sounds like you're making progress. Take care!
Well, that's not exactly reassuring.
Uhh... Nice piggy?
Argh! My eyes!
Argh! My eyes! The goggles do nothing!
*Sniff* *Sniff*
*Snort*
Well then, what do we have here?
Still breathing, eh...?
Seems I came at just the right time.
We'd better get you out of here before that thing returns.
W-what happened? Where am I?
I think I find out more about that monster from Spria in Draynor Village before heading back down there.
Oh, you're awake!
Who are you? How did I end up here?
My name's Spria and I'm a slayer master. You've had a nasty encounter with a Sourhog.
A Sourhog? You mean the giant pig monster?
Precisely. You're extremely lucky that I found you. Another few hours and you'd have been hog chow.
Were you responding to Sarah's bounty too?
Yes... It sounded like an easy few coins...
I thought as much. I found you on the floor of the cave, you must have been knocked unconscious.
That thing caught me completely off-guard. Normally I can handle myself in a fight, but its spitting attack is pretty fearsome!
I have an item for you that will help you on your quest, but you don't seem to have enough space. Come and see me again when you've cleared some room.
The beast's saliva is extremely acidic and your eyes are most vulnerable. It'll cause terrible injuries and leave you unable to attack or defend yourself very well.
So how am I supposed to handle that?
Luckily, the Slayer skill provides us with an array of useful equipment and techniques for dealing with... special foes.
In the case of our Sourhog, you'll be needing these.
This eyewear will protect you from the spitting attack, allowing you to fight the monster on equal terms.
Most enemies have a weakness, too. The Sourhog's thick hide provides excellent protection against slashing and insulates it from magic damage.
You'd be best trying to pierce it with arrows or a stabbing weapon.
Go now, the bounty is all yours to claim. I suggest you recoup your strength and head back to fight it using your new goggles.
If you make it out alive, collect your bounty and then come see me so that we can speak further.
Why are you helping me?
Well, I suppose I could have left you in there to be eaten...
But you know what that'd make me? A monster. And as a slayer master, that's really not a great look.
Besides, my father always taught me that knowledge is worth more than gold. I'm happy to sacrifice a few coins in order to pass my experience on to you.
Well, I sure am glad you were there to lend a hand. Thank you!
Don't mention it. Was there something else?
How did I end up back in Draynor Village?
I carried you out and dragged you back here to my house to recover, it really wasn't easy. You're welcome to rest here for as long as you need.
You said you were a slayer master. What's that?
There are many of us. We're experts in the ancient art of monster slaying. People from across Gielinor come to us for tasks and advice.
Well... actually, I'm fairly new to this. I've been learning from my father, Turael, for many years. We decided it was finally time for me to continue the family profession.
Can I have another pair of Reinforced Goggles?
No, you're still wearing the last pair I gave you!
You've still got the last one I gave you, it's there in your inventory! Those things aren't cheap, you know.
I know many people all across Gielinor, and my sources tell me you still have the last one in your bank.
Sure, I have another going spare. Please try to take better care of these.
What can you tell me about the Sourhog?
Well, I'm not much of a history buff... But I'll tell you what I know.
Many years back, before even I was around, there were two rival family farms not far from where we're standing.
Every year the village would hold a 'Finest Swine in Show' prize at the annual faire.
The same farmer would win year after year without fail. Driven mad with jealousy, his rival decided to hire a dodgy dark wizard to give him an edge over the competition.
The wizard attempted to alter the pig's appearance. I'm sure you can guess how well that went!
Long story short, the mutant, what we now know as a Sourhog, went on a brief rampage and escaped.
It must have somehow managed to reproduce, because people have reported seeing them in groups.
Up until now, so long as they were left alone, they'd keep to themselves. Rumors are, they live in deep underground caverns, scavenging what they can find.
But if they're living so close-by and attacking people on roads, then... they must be getting bold and trying to resurface.
That'll be all for now.
Very well. Good luck, slayer.
How goes it?
I don't want to go back down there without wearing the right equipment!
I don't think Spria will be rescuing me this time. If I go in there, I'm fighting this thing to the death!
Before I leave, I should go and collect a foot from that dead Sourhog as proof of my kill.
Perhaps I should speak with Spria and tell her that the monster's been dealt with.
'Ello, and what are you after then?
I did it! I killed the Sourhog!
Nicely done. Did you collect your reward from Sarah?
No, not yet.
Go and collect your reward and then come and speak with me.
That monster certainly won't be troubling you from now on.
Oh that's fantastic news! I'm so relie-
Wait, how do I know you're not just saying that to get the bounty?
I guess I'll go and get you some proof.
How about this as proof?
Eugh! Yes, that certainly looks about right!
Indeed, the smell is... something quite special.
I'll probably just give it to the dog.
I'm glad you made it back. Some strange woman in a hood came asking about the job shortly after you left. I didn't really want her back in here.
Anyway, thank you so much! Here's your reward.
Hello. How can I help you?
Feeling better now that the monster's gone?
Very much so! Thanks again. What was it, anyway?
It was a Sourhog. A giant bipedal pig creature!
Oh crumbs... I think I've heard of those... My grandfather was always rambling on about them.
Nevermind... that's all history now. Weren't you heading off to see Spria?
Yes, I suppose I should get going.
Safe travels!
I did it! I killed the Sourhog and collected the bounty from Sarah.
Very impressive, slayer. I'm glad that the goggles served you well.
Although, these Sourhogs often live in primitive tribes. I fear that where there's one, there's likely to be more to follow.
We may have to monitor that lair from time to time to keep their population in check.
I've noticed that you've unlocked the ability to craft slayer helms. From now on, when assembling one, fasten a pair of Reinforced Goggles to the eye holes to gain their benefit.
While we're on the topic, I can upgrade any of your existing slayer helms now.
That should do the trick.
By the way, you seem to have a natural talent for killing monsters. Would you like a new slayer task now?
Very well, come back if you change your mind.

characters.name: Pig Thing
characters.description: Monstrous pig creature, deep guttural voice with animalistic snorts and sniffs, aggressive and bestial, communicates through primitive sounds rather than words.

characters.name: Sarah
characters.description: Middle-aged female, warm British countryside accent, friendly but easily flustered tone, a hardworking farmer who runs a farming supply shop and is shaken after her encounter with the monster.

characters.name: Spria
characters.description: Young adult female, casual British accent, confident but approachable tone, a novice slayer master learning the family trade from her father Turael, helpful and knowledgeable about monsters.
